snippet: Prosecutors said the detective, John Malloy, forged several names on gun arrest forms and added himself as a tipster in order to collect $1,000.
abstract: New York City Police Detective John Malloy is arraigned in Manhattan and faces six counts of felony forgery and five counts of offering false instrument among other charges; Malloy is accused of providing fraudulent tip about illegal gun in order to collect reward from Operation Gun Stop program.
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors said the detective, John Malloy, forged several names on gun arrest forms and added himself as a tipster in order to collect $1,000.

headline.main: New York Police Detective Charged in Scheme to Get Reward for Gun Tip
headline.print_headline: Police Detective Is Charged in Scheme to Get Reward for a Gun Tip
